info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 8 at 2:18PM CDT until July 8 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Fayette and Lavaca.
* WHEN...Until 515 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 216 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yoakum, La Grange, Schulenburg, Hallettsville, High Hill, Engle, Moravia, Freyburg, Swiss Alp, Dubina, Komensky, Ammannsville, Breslau, O'Quinn, Witting, Holman, Mullins Prairie, Wied, Worthing, Plum, and Interstate 10 and Highway 90 between Flatonia and Schulenburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
